Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with Excellent staff! Can I move in?!”
Reviews.Author: BridgetteChavez
Reviews.Content: Coming from someone who travels quite frequently... this hotel was absolutely A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!!! Everything about this hotel is perfect, inside and out!!!! First off let me tell you that my stay was for an entire month. When having to travel this long on business you pray for hotels like this! I have never in my life seen any hotel or their staff go above and beyond as our friends at the holiday inn express downtown city centre did!!! They truly care about their guests! Their ultimate goal is EXCELLENCE in customer service! My stay was not only the most memorable hotel experience ever, but it was hard to leave such an awesome place where I felt welcomed and comfortable daily! To Jerry M. and the ENTIRE HIX staff Thank you, thank you, thank you.. from all +100 of our S.A.F.E. travel team... we thank you from the bottom of our hearts, you truly treated us like ROYALTY!!! Can't wait for Indy to host another Super Bowl!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: T K
Reviews.Content: In town for work. Hotel is great location if you are going to see the Colts Staff is pleasant, rooms clean.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in Indy”
Reviews.Author: Bill W
Reviews.Content: The hotel laundry did not work properly (washer or dryer). If you are staying on a Saturday night, be warned that you may not get to sleep before 2am. There is a night club on the back side of the building and I was not warned about the loud music. Had I known, I would have booked a room on the front side or stayed elsewhere. The hotel staff did not seem overly concerned nor did they offer to move me to another room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Lucas Stadium”
Reviews.Author: watchdog513
Reviews.Content: Hotel was perfect for attending the Colts game. Location for downtown was also very good. Rooms were nice and clean, water pressure in shower was great!!! Morning breakfast was normal for Holiday Inn, however the coffee was excellent. Staff was friendly, except for shuttle bus lady. Did not like the $5 charge to use the shuttle bus. Parking was $12 and lot is small. Over flow parking is in a near-by parking garage that we had to use 1 night. Rooms facing stadium may hear road noise, but we had no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and switch scheme”
Reviews.Author: MarcB94706
Reviews.Content: Although I reserved 2 rooms through their webservice for $97.99 plus tax/night. At checkout, they charged $107.99 plus tax/night. I had a printout of my reservation and showed the clerk, but she said she couldn't reverse it. I asked why they had hiked the price up, she didn't know. I ask, "Can I see a manager?" She says, Ms. E--- is away and left word not to be disturbed! I left my email for her to contact me, but she never did. Then I go to the Holiday Inn website and explain this to "Customer Care" and they never responded. SO BIG WARNING: these people are liable to charge you more than they agree to in the reservation, and you will be at their mercy. Take my advice, unless you don't care how much they charge you when you check out, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “good stay”
Reviews.Author: Joeyjoesgal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is accross from the Colts stadium. it is downtown and close to everything. The only issue I had with this hotel is 2 times I called before my scheduled date and verified if they were with in a block of conseco fieldhouse, i was told both times YES! and in fact NO they were not., they were 8-10 blocks from my concert. the hotel offered us a free shuttle to the event beacuse I was given wrong infomation. I felt this was a good fix. I dont know what else they could of done. I was very satisfied with this option and I tool them up on it. The hotel was nice and clean updated and the staff was very nice and considerate. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for Gen Con- Indianapolis Convention centre”
Reviews.Author: happyhang
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in our price range and we got more than we expected. The complimentary breakfast was just what we needed to start the day. It was within walking distance of the centre circle mall and the bus to the airport was across the street. The staff were great. They let us check in early (7am) because we had just gotten off a plane from Sydney-LA and were exhausted! The room was comfortable and the bed and other room amentities were also good. The wired internet access was also great. Only downside was the noise. traffic in the morning was loud and there is a freight train that runs through the city so you can hear it from most areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you don't mind getting no sleep!”
Reviews.Author: maripotter
Reviews.Content: Reserved the room through the 1-866 reservation line. Operator told me that they only had one HIE in all of Indianapolis. We drove by two on our way to this one! Upon arrival there were four or five scantily clad young ladies sitting on the sidewalk drinking beer outside the front door. It was approximately 12:30 am. My daughter and I were informed that there was no parking near the hotel and that we had to park a block away. It would cost $12.00. My daughter had already unpacked the bags onto the rolling valet so I took the car to the garage myself. Not a great idea! Midnight and city alleyways was not very safe. The night manager was not courteous at all. When I expressed my concerns about the parking situation he said, "You haven't competely checked in yet, you could go somplace elsse you know." I assured him that at 12:30 am I wasn't going to be looking for another hotel. We arrived at our room which was clean, no complaints there but as we were opening the door a pack of teenagers in the bathing suits ran down the hallway screaming obscenities and nearly knocked us down. I assume that these creatures didn't get any sleep that night because every ten minutes or so they would return to our hallway, running, laughing, screaming and knocking on doors. I called the manager who said he couldn't control everyone in the hotel, but he would try to find them. Needless to say, they were smarter and much more energetic that he was and they continued to run rampant. My 17 yr old daughter went out into the hallway at 4:00 am and took care of the little hoodlums. Did I forget to mention the poor screaming baby above us on the fourth floor? Poor kid must have been there by him or herself because no one could stop the crying... After getting absolutely NO SLEEP, we check out at 6:30 am. I personally checked out returning the keys with eye contact and was never asked about our stay or anything.. I would NOT recommend this particular HIE to anyone, ever. I wrote to HOliday Inn to alret them to this problem, who sent my concerns on to the specific HIE's management... guess what? I haven't heard a thing. What did I expect? Somehow we have lost the whole concept of service business and what they really should be doing for their paying customers.

Reviews.Title: “No reason not to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JasonMillerOdon
Reviews.Content: I will start my review by saying that there is no reason for my family to not return here again. The location is of this property is very easy to find and they have on site parking directly out the front door. There is a $12 parking fee each night. The front desk staff was very easy to talk with and we had no problems with unanswered questions. The entire staff for that matter was professional and polite throughout our entire stay. Our room was a double bed room with Lucas Oil Stadium directly out our 6th floor window. The room was very clean, neat and in order when we arrived. The beds were very comfortable and the A/C unit worked the entire time. There wasn't a fridge or microwave in our room. The pool was on the small side although while we stayed at this hotel there was never more then 4 people including us in the pool at one time. The hot tub was normal size however the jets didn't work for us during our stay. The pool area was clean and well kept. The workout room was equipped with several pieces of equipment of which I used the elliptical machine for a half hour one night and watched tv in the workout room. It was clean and well kept. The continental breakfast was the reason I gave this hotel a 4 instead of a 3. There was alot of different items to chose from and every item was fresh and had good taste. Overall, a clean hotel with polite and friendly staff means there isn't a reason for me to not bring my family back. However, we will probably try another downtown hotel if and when we return to Indy. If you are coming for a football game this is the hotel to book as it is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: travelfreak53
Reviews.Content: We were in Indianapolis for the Final Four basketball tournament and this Holiday Inn was an ideal spot for us. The hotel lobby, rooms, bathrooms and dining area were spotlessly clean. Check in and check out were done quickly and efficiently. Breakfast was your typical hotel fare, but was ample and all items were readily refilled. Complimentary copies of USA Today were available in the breakfast room. After we checked out, we discovered that the GPS that came with our rental car was broken. I went back in to ask for directions and the desk clerk, Kesha, immediately entered our destination address into the computer and printed out Google directions for us. We made our way to Bloomington with no problems, thanks to her assistance. Many thanks to her for making the next leg of our journey possible. The hotel was an easy walk to the Conseco Field House where the tourney was played and is right across the street from the Lucas Oil Stadium, so whatever athletic event you are going to Indy for, consider this hotel. My one negative is the $12 a night parking charge. That seemed a little steep to me.

Reviews.Title: “our time thier”
Reviews.Author: cookindiana
Reviews.Content: i just want to say formt eh time we walked in this hotel to the time we left the staff was extremly friendly!!! went out of their way to make sure we got in to our room before game time to shower and dress !!! the lady lekesha was extrmetly nice and helpful!!!! she need a raise her openness and freindlyness in sured we will be back to stay thier agian and i will be sure to tell all our friend and family about the hotel !!!! thank you , your staff made our time in indy very remeberable!!!! beth brewer

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: ToddSIndiana
Reviews.Content: We haven't had to stay in this hotel for several years, and we remembered that it was nice on our last visit. We were very happy to see renovations that made the property even nicer than it was last time. The staff and the service were excellent and we couldn't have asked for more. If you need to stay in the Indianapolis area, this is a great choice that is close to everything downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Overnite Stay”
Reviews.Author: sanberk
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels and inns throughout the country..this was one of the cleanest,friendliest places weve visited. The service was impecable,along with the complimentary breakfast..my husband likes the eggs and meat whereas i do the yogurt and oatmeal the variety was awesome..thank you so much for a pleasant experience....Sandi Berkley

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: blakestravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is MUCH nicer than a Holiday Inn Express off the side of the Interstate. I was not to happy finding out that I would be staying at a Holiday Inn Express, but when I got there I changed my mind! I love that it is Literally across the street from Lucas Oil. I stayed on the top (6th) floor. They have 2 elevators and they are a bit slow simply because they are MRL Otis Gen2 Series 1. I reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home”
Reviews.Author: Greydog98
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel for over a year now on buiness trips, and the comfort level is among the best! (If nto the TOP!!) After 14 years of traveling I have stayed in several hundred hotels of all brands and styles. I look for the friendliness and caring of the staff. This hotel and staff makes me feel one of the family and welcomes me home everytime! Being right downtown it is very close to everything (Lucas Oil Stadium right across the street and the New Convention a half a block away) The noise from traffic alittle loud but that comes with the downtown life. If you stay here, be prepared to be pampered and welcomed as one of their family!!!

Reviews.Title: “Such a grat place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nakisha24
Reviews.Content: this was a wonderfull hotel. the staff was nice and knew all bout downtown and all the activity going on. the hotel was also very very clean. i will be back in indy in a few months and this is the hotel ill be staying at. thanks for such a great stay

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular property, ideal location to Lucas, good service”
Reviews.Author: wouldbeworldtraveler
Reviews.Content: I really liked this property! Decor in the property was new, modern, bright, and had a "nouveau Art Deco" look about it. From the pieces of sculpture/art in the lobby to the lighting and wallpaper, it was a comfortable public area. Hallways on floors were bright, clean, well maintained and comfortable. Rooms themselves were clean, comfortable, well-lit and continued with the boutique hotel feel about it. Flat-screen televisions were also nice. I had a comfortable sleep with the beds with comfy sheets and coverings. Bathroom was nicely decorated with (likely) faux granite countertops and nice sconce lighting. If you wanted additional lighting you could also turn on a overhead light in the bathroom. If you are going to Lucas, you literally cannot get any closer than this hotel. It is literally across the street. The rest of downtown is within about a 10 minute walk or very short drive (I would walk as opposed to keep moving a car and paying for additional parking, but that's my preference). Also, if here for Indy Indians baseball or part of the Indiana Convention Center (whenever Indianapolis decides to finish it), this will be a very convenient hotel to these also. Breakfast was your typical HI Express breakfast, an expanded continental option with hot items, cold items, and of course the signature cinnamon rolls. You should be able to get a relatively decent breakfast. Staff was all generally pleasant and was nice enough to let me store luggage behind the Front Desk between the time I vacated the room and time I left Indy, so I didn't have to leave luggage in the car. While I've so far been pretty much an ad for this hotel (but believe everything I'm writing), there's a few items I didn't perfectly like. You will have some street noise from the rooms -especially if you have a street facing room. If you're a very light sleeper, it may be a problem, but I didn't personally find it that bad. Internet is free at the hotel, though only wired from what I could see. My laptop did find wi-fi signals if from nearby (such as Lucas) for a fee. Parking is not free at the hotel, though for a downtown location not terrible at $10/night. Finally, there were a few very minor maintenance items in my room, but nothing that really took from the overall enjoyment of the room. Finally, more restaurants within a block or so would be handy. Right now, only a few fast food on the other side of Lucas and a small bar or two. It does appear a new place is opening next door to the hotel this fall, which will be a nice addition to the neighborhood. Overall, I look forward to going back to this hotel next time I might be in Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night, very nice furnishings, next to Lucas Oil.”
Reviews.Author: btravel93
Reviews.Content: We booked a room through hotwire for $57. It was downtown and I was willing to gamble given that it was one night and 90% of people from hotwire liked it. It is right next to Lucas Oil Stadium. If you take a left out of the complex and then two rights at 10am you can purchase tickets for a Lucas Oil tour at 11am. They will tell you where to park, it is down the road a little and to the right. $5 to park. You enter through the pro shop for your tour. The hotel I knew was updated having been a previous hotel at some point, you could tell that from the hot tub. The rooms look new, the furnishings are very nice and nice artwork on the walls. The king room with pull out sofa was next to the street and you could see the stadium. We had to keep the air on low all night to cover some of the street noise, it was fine for a night. The room had a fridge, mini sink and microwave. The shower was very easy to work. Everything was clean except for one stray hair on the bed, again, for one night and the price I paid, I wasn't complaining. When I checked in the lady was not as friendly as some other hotels I have stayed at and reviewed on here, but she checked me in and told me the hot tub itself wouldn't be open until 5pm because they were refilling it. Great, it is nice to know they clean the area. I have kids, the highlight of a stay in a hotel is getting to swim after a long day of sight seeing. At 515 we go downstairs and see an out of service sign on the the whole pool area. No! ( for my sanity ). I go to the front desk and a new lady had come in at 3 pm after I checked in. I asked her when the pool would be open and she asked maintenance and came back with an 8 pm reply. No smile, no sorry, no I apologize but we had to do this and I'm sure you understand. She didn't know I wasn't paying a full rate, and it shouldn't have mattered. Because I do understand things happen, it was the lack of friendliness overall on this trip that leads me to only recommend it for a night. We went to the pool at 640 to check and see perhaps was it open? And it was, we got in our swim before bedtime. We had a great time, it was clean and nice. They have a "SuiteShop". If you forget anything, or want ice cream or soda, they have it there. No milk though. I heard no sounds on a Monday night from any other rooms. We ordered pizza from a local Mancino's pizza place featured in the room directory and they delivered. I would recommend this for a one night stay, with family or otherwise. I think in general a lot of hotels don't seem to have the "welcome to HIE thank you for staying with us, how was your stay etc? " Just general friendliness I guess I want to stay, and since I'm trying to relax and make some memories with my family those are the sorts of places I just won't stay in more than once.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in a jacuzzi room”
Reviews.Author: marty_erikksen
Reviews.Content: We arrived late by train and were given a jacuzzi room - nice! We didn't expect this, but it made the stay even nicer. Bedding was comfortable. Location right across from Lucas Oil Stadium and 5 minutes walk from the train station was perfect. A shuttle to the airport is a block away. There was an additional fee to park in their lot, but we didn't have a car, so it was not an issue with us. Breakfast at holiday inn expresses are really nice, with quite a nice spread of hot and cold dishes. I recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely upgraded Holiday Inn Express”
Reviews.Author: RickyBobbie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right next to Lucas Oil Stadium and has been significantly upgraded. It's one of the better Holiday Inn Expresses we've stayed at--rooms are comfortable and modern. It's a little noisy because of location and it's not convenient to downtown. Breakfasts are typical for Holiday Inn Express. Front desk staff are friendly. Exercise room has a few cardio machines and there is a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: here8050
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a brief trip to Indy. We checked in on a Thursdays night. The hotel is newly renovated and it looks very nice. The rooms were spacious and clean and the lobby was kept tidy as well. The breakfast was typical and decent for a hotel comp breakfast. The desk staff was very friendly. The only problem I had is that the street noise was very loud on Friday morning. I probably wouldn't want to stay here during the week bc the one side of the hotel sits on a major street, right next to a stop light. So on a busy workday you are woke up bright and early around 5:30/6am by the sounds of loud traffic, horns and engines. I am a light sleeper and we have small children so this was a problem for me. I will rectify by saying that on Saturday morning it was quiet but I assume it is because no one works on the weekends. Lucas Field was directly across the street so I can only assume if there was a game or concert or other event it would be very loud as well. Obviously this is not the hotels fault it is just the location of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “review”
Reviews.Author: KnightMetal
Reviews.Content: this is a very good, very clean place full of nice employees!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sprint99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the IMIS event at the convention center. This hotel is pretty new and directly across from The Lucas Oil Stadium. Check-in went fairely well and we we're handled professionaly and promtply. The only situation upon check-in was the fault of our companies booking agent, as all of our rooms (3) were reserved under our individual names and not the company, which created some confusion for both us and the front desk staff- but was handled with the upmost care and professionalism. The front desk clerk didn't skip a beat. Our rooms we're nice, clean, comfy, and all appeared to be in working condition. This hotel does have an indoor pool and whirlpool area- though as much as I wished to utilize I was unable to. I did however enjoy the breakfast area and food served. Hot eggs, bacon, sausage, and other various choices. Very impressive. The free internet access was a huge plus! Parking was alright. There is a sports bar 1/2 block adjacent to the hotel property which was nice too. Plenty of restaurants and nightlife only blocks away. We sampled many and enjoyed all. Our entire staff enjoyed this hotel, though due to the weather this particular week the walk to the convention center got a little old. Though that is only a personal item based on myself and co-workers- it should not detour anyones choice of this hotel. Would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, can't believe the experiences of prior posters!”
Reviews.Author: billmelater123
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on it's prime location next to Lucas Oil Stadium. I found it to be exceptionally clean, even the room carpets, which are sometimes the least appealing part of a room. Our room was spacious and welcoming, the linens fresh and the bathroom large and sparkling. The breakfast room was clean and the food tasty and plentiful. We had no problem with the wi-fi and the flat screen TV was nice. I stay at many Holiday Inn Expresses and found this to be one of the nicest ones (although most are great). The staff was exceptionally pleasant and I would stay again in a heartbeat. I truly cannot believe that other posters here found this hotel dirty. I am extremely picky about my accomodations, and was very pleased during my three-night stay. It is a bit of a far walk to most of the other downtown amenities, such as most restaurants and the mall, but not too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Rude, false advertised and smelly”
Reviews.Author: Indianapolis2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems nice in the common area, but that's where it ends. Our room had a horrible odor (old cigarette smoke) that got worse with the heat turned on. The shower floor did not seem clean. Many channels were offered on tv, but you could not access them. The pool room had dirty towels laying all over and again I questioned the cleanliness of the floor. BUT our BIGGEST PROBLEM with this hotel was with the people behind the desk. This hotel's website AND in room information claims that parking is free. Well, what they don't tell you when you sign in, is that you are signing to a $10 non-refundable parking fee. We talked to 2 different people who were either unhelpful, or VERY unwilling to do anything about this. The manager was rude and discourteous and refused to acknowledge the "free parking" even when we showed her the website. What ever happened to admitting your mistake?? or even "The costumer is right." This place left a very BAD taste in my mouth and a smell in my nose. I will NOT be returning. There are MANY MANY MANY other great area hotels!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, decent location”
Reviews.Author: pipip
Reviews.Content: We arrived earlier than check-in time, but the receptionist happily checked us in. The room was in excellent shape. It was spacious, clean, well decorated, and had a flat screen TV. We had a great view of the stadium across the road. There were no events at the stadium during our stay. There was a coffee machine, with good quality coffee supplied. The bathroom was spacious, and never steamed up once during showers. Towels were always soft. We made us of the pool and spa, and these were very good. Well maintained, clean, and with plenty of fresh towels available. The sunbed area outside the pool is small, but got good sun. There is passing traffic nearby, and a view of the energy plant(?), but these did not interfere with our enjoyment of the sun area. Breakfast was very good, always a variety of options both hot and cold, and always fresh, replenished by helpful staff. There is wi-fi in the hotel, but it did not extend to our room (3rf floor). The room did have a socket for wired internet, but we did not try it. However, wi-fi worked fine in the lobby and dining area. There is also a computer and printer in the dining area, free for customers to use. There always seemed to be fresh coffee on tap in the dining area, which helped make this area a pleasant place to spend time. Parking was no problem, but has to be paid for ($10 per day, still cheaper than many places in town, although we did spot one nearby car park that was offering weekday parking for $5 per day on SOME days of the week, but not all days). The hotel is within walking distance of the centre of downtown, although some people might find it a bit too far to walk to Monument Circle. We found it fine, and also walked to White River Park and the museums and canal. The lobby has a useful small shop selling all sorts of things such as umbrellas and ready meals (which you could heat up in the microwave in the dining area). We chose this hotel because it seemed to offer the best balance of price and convenience of location for downtown. We were slightly apprehensive that it might be too far from the centre, but believe now that we made the best choice. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but cleaniness is not their priority”
Reviews.Author: stones2125
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very convenietly located right across from the Colts stadium and within walking distance of many attractions. We were excited when we arrived. However that excitment faded when our daughter took out a blanket and found it covered in long hairs. More hairs were found on the bed spread and on the bathroom floor. When confronted the front desk, they said the hotel was full but they would send up someone to sweep. They said it would be an hour because their cleaning person was also their shuttle driver. Several hours later we were still waiting. We once again went to the front desk and was told the cleaning person had left for the evening. They offered us new sheets but said we would have to put them on ourselves. They also made the comment that "Like most hotels, we wash our comforters quarterly"...there is a "comforting" thought! All in all, the staff did not seem suprised about the issue and really showed no eagerness to set it right. They did provide a slight discount to our bill, but I would have rather paid full price for a clean room!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed at in Indy”
Reviews.Author: kyl33t
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for my bachelorette party and loved it! It's a great hotel for friends and casual trips to the city. It's within 10 blocks of the bars, so it would be a cheap cab ride if you couldn't make it back. It's right next to Lucas Oil, so it'd be perfect for games and concerts. The rooms were perfectly clean, staff friendly, parking was more affordable than central downtown garages, and it was quiet and comfortable. I've had great experiences with Holiday Inns in other cities, so it's nice to see they are on the same level in my home city.

Reviews.Title: “Staff goes way above and beyond!”
Reviews.Author: BounderBaby
Reviews.Content: My husband is staying at the hotel for a 5 day convention and has stayed there for the past 2 years for the same event.This morning at breakfast a very nice staff member completely dished his breakfast plate and when they asked if he would like anything else he told them that he was going to grab another plate for his buisness partner. They completely dished him another full plate! He was amazed. He didn't expect to get waited on. Since he would be gone over Valentine's Day I was desperately trying to find him a small gift that he wouldn't have to pack home. I contacted the hotel via email to see if they could help me out. Amazingly the promptly wrote back first thing in the morning. This is what I got,"We would be happy to assist. Please advise what you would like for us to pick up, and I will have someone on my staff take care of this. Regards, Christine Robinson General Manager" All I can say is wow! He also says that the beds and pillows are very comfortable. He is an avid business traveler and it it rare to hear him praise a hotel. Way to go HIexpress

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for Colts Fans!”
Reviews.Author: TexasGirl1234
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and accommodating when we came to hotel. Because the NFL game was across the street we couldn't check in until after 4pm because so many rooms needed to be cleaned, but they gave us parking pass so we could stay in hotel. Friendly in evening too, but front desk look tired in the morning when we checked out. Which I totally understand. I will be staying again at the hotel when I fly out for another Colts NFL game.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is fine”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandBeachBoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business and it was booked through Hotwire. It was clean and new. I arrived late at nite to check in to my room and left in the morning. The lobby was pleasant and the breakfast was adequate to get some morning food. The location seemed nice especially for the football games although if you're looking for something near the city circle center, this would not be the place. It was fine though, I was satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: notdenise
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for a birthday weekend with two friends. It was clean, the staff were friendly and we had a good time. It has FREE on-site parking, which I think is always a plus for a downtown hotel. If you are going to Indy for an event in the RCA Dome or Lucas Oil Stadium, you can't get much closer than this. Lucas Oil Stadium is literally across the street, and RCA Dome is about a 2 block walk. The pool was clean with ample towels. The room was clean too. The hot breakfast was not as good as advertised on TV (they never are). They were out of scrambled eggs and bananas (the only fresh fruit option) by the time we got down there each morning (about 9am), which was disappointing. Did have ample bagels, bread, muffins, cinnamon rolls, yogurt, and beverages. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smithinlast
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with spacious rooms. Our room (311) had a pull out sofa so there was plenty of room for the kids to move around when the bed was folded into the couch. The furnishings were very nice and for a minute I wished that my wife and I were both staying the night at the hotel without the kids. We had a great view of the RCA Dome and of the new stadium which is under construction. The kids enjoyed staring out the window at the traffic, people, and construction. The hotel is in a great spot and it seemed like everything was just a few steps from the front doors. Our complimentary breakfast was great. The dining area was really nice. The kids and I filled our plates several times. There was a TV on so I could hear some of the morning news. I can only complain about a few things. The pool and hot tub are way in need of an update. The surfaces appeared dirty. I believe it was clean but just stained. Still, the kids loved the pool and the workout room. Also, our toilet got clogged twice and there was no plunger in the room. Not sure if this is a problem in other rooms. Parking, though free, seemed like it could really be a hassle if there is an event going on. It may be a good idea to get there early especially on the weekend. The lot is pretty small, and I heard the front desk clerk telling one guest to "go ahead and park in the handicapped spot". Overall we enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Billy Bird
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly basic, but good hotel. Rooms are comfortable, staff are nice. The hotel is in a bit of an odd area: it is located behind a 'steam plant' and has deliveries by rail at frequent periods throughout the day. If you sleep like a log, like me, this isn't really a problem, but light sleepers, beware! They are currently building a new stadium right next to the hotel (to house the Indianapolis football team), which may or may not be good news. I was there for an exhibition, and the hotel was about 10 minutes walk from the convention centre, and you pass the baseball ground 'victory field' on the way. It is also within walking distance of the city centre mall and various car rental firms as well as the white river national park. Overall, it was an ok sort of place to stay, but there are other hotels in the area which might be a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: MidwestGuy11
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and comfortable. I was in town for an event at the convention center and hotel was within walking distance. The free parking was a huge savings when I compared other downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: Grotshops
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located adjacent to the RCA Dome and near the convention center. It also offers free parking for guests, which saves you anywhere from $12 up per day if you're driving. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The free continental breakfast is fairly standard. It's an easy walk to most downtown attractions. I stayed in a king studio suite, which is a very large room with a good work space and a refrigerator. Free internet was another plus. If you don't need the amenities of a fancier hotel, this place is an excellent value in downtown Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is not a fancy hotel, but very comfortable and very clean. It is close to every thing downtown. The breakfast was good, and the staff friendly. The price was reasonable.
